title: Real projective plane
summary: In mathematics, the real projective plane is an example of a compact non-orientable two-dimensional manifold; in other words, a one-sided surface.  It cannot be embedded in standard three-dimensional space without intersecting itself. It has basic applications to geometry, since the common construction of the real projective plane is as the space of lines in R 3 {\displaystyle \mathbb {R} ^{3}} passing through the origin.
